intro: Pasania ischnostachya, commonly known as the narrow-stalked pasania, is a member of the grass family Poaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of spikelets, which are typically greenish or reddish in color. Pasania ischnostachya is often found in open woodland and grassland habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
